encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)

stringValue.value: Looks Up an item associated with key: cacheKey in cache with ID: cacheID and returns it in values, if the item exists.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. number of entries for this cache (optional if a default value exists)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)
Max. size for each entry (optional if a default value exists)
The message to be cached (required, must exist in the preceeding policy context)

stringValue.value: Writes an item to cache with ID: cacheID with key: cacheKey.  If the cache does not exist, one will be created.  If the key exists, the existing item will be overwritten.
This assertion returns an error message, http status and content-type value associated with the given 'Error code'.

A value combined with the given error code. If, for example, an API would be identifiedby the values '1234' and the given error code is '111' the exported variable 'error.code' would contain '1234111'
A value associated with a certain error. If that value is unkown it will be replaced with '000' within the output variable 'error.code'
Exports variables that are required to process OAuth requests.
Exports variables that contain OTK configurations that are related to the persistence layer

Retrieves all id_token values from the persistence layer. The following parameters are valid in combination:
                    (resource_owner, azp), (sub, azp), (jwt)

Retrieves values for an id_token. Depending on the configuration the values will be looked up via local database using using 'OTK id_token DB Lookup' or via routing assertion to an endpoint that implements the database access. The following parameters are valid in combination: (resource_owner, azp), (sub, azp), (jwt).
Validates a given id_token. If 'check expiration' is set to 'false' the expiration date will only be exported but not validated.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. number of entries for this cache (optional if a default value exists)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)
Max. size for each entry (optional if a default value exists)

stringValue.value: Removes an item with key: cacheKey from cache with ID:  cacheID
Modifies the session database table depending on the input parameters. This encas should not be used directly. Use the corresponding encas found at the 'manage/session' folder.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Name of cache to be used

stringValue.value: Creates a new session or updates a matching existing one. Use this for temporary values.
Look up attributes for a given username.
Supported request_object_signing_alg_values as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api
Exports variables that are required to process Software Statement Assertion.

encapsulatedassertion.name: OTK Add or Update XML element

stringValue.value: Exports the server location that implements the OVP (OAuth Validation Point) endpoints.
Returns values from the token database. 'tokentype' can either be 'token' or 'temporary'.
Retrieves long living tokens from the token database.
Retrieves client values from the persistence layer. To find out how the parameters can by used refer to the OTK API documentation.
Retrieves values about the given client (or client_id) using the input parameters.
Use 'get' to retrieve client values, 'getKey' for client_id values. 'getAll' is only valid in combination with 'Client ID'
Used to define the OTK OAUTH2 Server running profile.
Finds the OAuth 2.0 access_token within the http request header, as http request parameter or uses the given one. If will fail if a token is found at multiple locations.
This encapsulated assertion is used to validate JWT as OAuth Token. Customization to the default implementation can be done in the configuration policy #OTK Validate JWT OAuth Token
This encass converts base64 encoded string to base64url encoded string

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Pass if any of the required RESOURCEs are found (true|false)?
Fail if the SCOPE is found (true|false)?
Pass if any of the required SCOPEs are found (true|false)?

stringValue.value: Verifies SCOPE and fails if the requested SCOPE does not match the granted one.
A space separated list of granted/ valid SCOPE values
A space separated list of required SCOPE values
Deletes token from the persistence layer.
Deletes a token from the persistence layer.
Validates a given Bearer token profile access_token.
Generates request MAC using HMAC-SHA1 algorithm
Validates a given MAC token profile access_token.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Fail if this SCOPE was granted?
Disallow retrieving access_token from query string
Pass if any of the required audience are found ?

stringValue.value: Validates an OAuth 2.0 access_token for a request. By default the request will fail if the given access_token has expired or does not match the given configuration.
Time in seconds for which the access_token will not be validated again. Use this value as a compromise between increasing performance and security. A typical value would be '30'
Use this field if no access_token is received through the request message but was issued out-of-band
If set to 'true' the access_token (and the associated refresh_token) will be invalidated after being used once. Default = 'false'
If set to 'true' the assertion fails if the given SCOPE was granted for this access_token
A space separated list of SCOPE values this access_token MUST have been granted for
The content-type of the 'error.msg' if it exists
The client_id for which the access_token was granted
A JSON structure containing the used grant_type, the client_type and values specified in the custom field of the associated client_id
The SCOPE that was granted to the access_token
The user who granted the access_token/ client
Exports variables with configured lifetimes for OAuth tokens and OAuth client credentials. The variable names end with an indicator for the time unit such as seconds (sec,s) or minutes (m)

Exports variables that are used as OAuth token or OAuth client credentials. At least and at most one of the input parameters should be configured to 'true'. If 'true' is selected mutiple times the 'first one' wins. If none is selected with 'true' the assertion will fail.
The expiration date in seconds (10-digits). The value depends on configurations of 'OTK Token Lifetime Configuration'
The lifetime in seconds. The value depends on configurations of 'OTK Token Lifetime Configuration'
Sets default values for inputs when they are empty
Sets default values for inputs if they are empty
Persists values into the client store database.
Use it to persist a new client, a new client_id or both.
If set to 'true' provide values for these REQUIRED parameters: Client Identifier (DB pk), Description, Client Name, Organization, Registered By, Client Type, and OPTIONAL: Client Custom values
If set to 'true' provide values for REQUIRED parameters as specified for 'New Client' and 'New Client ID'

If set to 'true' provide values for these REQUIRED parameters: Client Identifier (DB pk), Client ID, Client Secret, Expiration, Registered By, Status, and OPTIONAL: Redirect URI, Environment, Valid SCOPE, Client Key Custom values, Service IDs, Account Plan Mapping IDs
List of the JWS RFC7515 signing algorithms (alg values) JWA RFC7518 supported by the authorization endpoint to sign the response.
List of the JWE RFC7516 encryption algorithms (alg values and enc values) JWA RFC7518 supported by the authorization endpoint to encrypt the response.

Requires a request to use SSL and optionally present a client certificate. It is not authenticating the client, just requiring its certificate.
                    Use this encapsulated assertion at the beginning of the API policy. Preced 'OTK FIP Client Authentication' with this assertion.
A pipe separated list of accepted http methods
Authenticates a client certificate against a configured IDP. Use this encas after 'OTK Require SSL (with Client Certificate)' if it is configured to require a client certificate
Configure an API identifier if it should be combined with 'error.code'. Use it to identify a specific API.

encapsulatedassertion.name: Portal Look Up API Key DB

stringValue.value: Retrieves an API Key from the data storage. It will not find a result if the given Service ID is not available for the given API Key

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)

stringValue.value: Empties cache with ID:  cacheID, removing all contents.  maxEntryAge is the value that the cache was first created with.

encapsulatedassertion.name: Portal API Key Record Cache Delete

stringValue.value: This assertion is to delete the cache of the list of <(ApiKey, ApiId), planId>.

encapsulatedassertion.name: Portal API Key Record Cache Upsert

stringValue.value: This assertion is to upsert entries to the cache of the list of <(ApiKey, ApiId), planId>.

Persists synchronized API Keys and OAuth client credentials from the CA API Portal to the datastorage. The assertion fails if at least one insert statement (on API Key or OAuth Client or OAuth Client Key) fails.
The JSON message MUST match the format of the CA Portal Sync message
Converts plain text client_secret to hashed
Deletes a client configuration including all its depending client_keys (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key).
Updates a client or a client_key.
Returns a count of non-master Client Keys associated to a given App (client_ident).
Returns a count of Access Tokens associated with a given Client (App) and resource owner.
Revokes a token or many, depending on the parameters used.
Ensure OTK Token count is within configured limits
Disables tokens issued for the given client_key (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key).
Returns a count of Access Tokens associated with a given Client (App).
Performs DB store operation on the DAG token details
Persists an id_token. An existing id_token of the given user will be replaced.
Retrieves DAG token details from RDBMS

Removes the given id_token. This is equal to a user logout since client apps are not able to use that id_token anymore to request access_token. id_token will be selected by either (jwt) or (azp). (logout_apps) will either also delete associated acces_token or not.
Support customized id token signing algorithm configuration
Exports variables of all grant types.
Supported id_token_signing_alog as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Third Party SSO Token in base64
Time of authentication (default: now in seconds)

stringValue.value: Generates an id_token using a configured algorithm.

Registers an id_token for the user. Depending on the configuration the values will be persisted via local database using using 'OTK id_token DB Persist' or via routing assertion to an endpoint that implements the database access.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Cache ID (default will be used if not given)

stringValue.value: Protect against replay attack using local cache on a single node or use database for multi-node cluster.
Validates JWT as client credentials using auth_method and algorithm used to register the client
Validates values for the given client_id. It will fail if the client_id is a 'master'key'. Other values will only be validated if they are given.
This value MUST be the output of the assertion 'OTK Client GET' configured with parameter 'Operation to use = getAll'
A message containing details about the client if the validation was successful. Default message format: xml

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Name of cache to be used

stringValue.value: Retrieve session values from the database. The result has to be URL decoded.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Name of cache to be used
Maximum age for Cache in seconds as it was created

stringValue.value: Deletes a session from the session store database.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Success: Add additional values that may be displayed for login or consent

stringValue.value: Provides variables used to generate the authorization servers website. It references 'resource_owner', 'scope', 'client_name' and 'sessionID', 'host_login_server', 'path_login_server', 'host_consent_server', 'path_consent_server' implicitly.
This variable contains the HTML page for success messages
This variable contains the HTML page for error messages
Returns values from the token database. 'tokentype' can either be 'token' or 'temporary'.
Retrieves long living tokens from the token database.
Revokes a token or many, depending on the parameters used.
Updates the token status. Valid status are 'ENABLED' and 'DISABLED'.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Prompt type for reauthentication and consent

stringValue.value: Authenticates users through different means. It authenticates users against the configured IDP
This value will only be respected if 'Username' is empty
The name of the cookie that should be found in the value of 'Cookie-Header'. This value will only be respected if 'Username' is empty
By default a SiteMinder SSO token (not the SMSESSION cookie) used to re-authenticate a user. This is for MAG installations only
Escapes HTML characters in the input
Retrieves client values from the persistence layer for use by the OAuth Manager. To find out how the parameters can by used refer to the OTK API documentation.
Retrieves values about the given client (or client_id) using the input parameters. For use by OAuth Manager.
Use 'get' to retrieve client values, 'getKey' for client_id values. 'getAll' is only valid in combination with 'Client ID'
Exports an OAuth client_id configuration as JSON message. For use by OAuth Manager.
If set to 'true' the client_secret will be exported. Default = 'false'
This xml MUST be the output of the assertion 'OTK Client GET' configured with parameter 'Operation to use = getAll'
Supported token_endpoint_auth_methods as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api
Validates client metadata configured in the client_key_custom
Persists values into the client store database. For use by OAuth Manager.
Use it to persist a new client, a new client_id or both. For use by OAuth Manager.
If set to 'true' provide values for these REQUIRED parameters: Client Identifier (DB pk), Description, Client Name, Organization, Registered By, Client Type, and OPTIONAL: Client Custom values
If set to 'true' provide values for REQUIRED parameters as specified for 'New Client' and 'New Client ID'

If set to 'true' provide values for these REQUIRED parameters: Client Identifier (DB pk), Client ID, Client Secret, Expiration, Registered By, Status, and OPTIONAL: Redirect URI, Environment, Valid SCOPE, Client Key Custom values, Service IDs, Account Plan Mapping IDs
Deletes a client configuration including all its depending client_keys (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). Used by OAuth Manager.

Deletes a client registration including all its depending client_key's (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). Nevertheless, client_key's that have been used MAY still be valid for a configured cache lifetime. For use by OAuth Manager.
Updates a client or a client_key. For use by OAuth Manager.
Updates a client configuration. For use by OAuth Manager.

encapsulatedassertion.name: OTK Manager Client DB Revoke Key

stringValue.value: Deletes a client_key (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). For use by OAuth Manager.
Deletes a client_key (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). For use by OAuth Manager.
Updates a client_key configuration. For use by OAuth Manager.
Disables tokens issued for the given client_key (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). For use by OAuth Manager.
Disables tokens issued for given client_key (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). For use by OAuth Manager.

Configure CORS as required, optional or to be ignored. By default OTK uses this assertion at protected API's. If set to 'ignore' CORS will not be handled. OTK sets the variable 'custom' to a JSON structure containing 'key=url_path_query' containing the API path and query components. Default: optional
Provides all variables that are required to configure the authorization server
This secret is used to sign the session JWT. It has to be configured on an external login-consent server if it should be integrated
Supported require_request_uri_registration as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api
Looks up JWT Request Object from given request uri
Validate and export claims in the authorize JWT request

Authenticates an OAuth client by its client_id and client_secret. In addition, other required values can be configured as input parameters. The authentication will fail if any of the given parameters do not match attributes of that client.
This value can be used instead of 'Client ID/ Client Secret' and vice versa. In addition this value will only be respected if 'Allow authentication via HTTP Header' is set to 'true'
'Client ID/ Client Secret' will only be respected if 'Allow authentication via Query Parameter' is set to 'true'
Takes JSON object to place them in the custom content for oauth sessions
Supported response_types as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery API
Validates the inital client request hitting the authorization endpoint.
Performs store operation on the DAG token details
Prepares (and persists) the DAG response details
Performs store operation on the CIBA token details
Supported Json Web Keys as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect JWKS api

stringValue.value: To get client certificate from the request
To validate mTLS cerificate during the DCR
Use to retrieve JWKS from the given url
To compose DCR request from the JWT payloads

Supported subject_types as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api

                Currently none are supported

Persists an OAuth 2.0 access_token. The token secret is optional.

Deletes a client registration including all its depending client_key's (client_id/ oauth_consumer_key). Nevertheless, client_key's that have been used MAY still be valid for a configured cache lifetime.
Defined for openid discovery configuration endpoint for debug purpose.

Supported JWKS_URI as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api.
It required 'host_oauth2_auth_server' and 'jwks_uri_oauth' as input

Supported userinfo endpoint as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api.
It requires 'host_oauth2_auth_server' and 'userinfo_oauth' as input

It required 'host_oauth2_auth_server' and 'oidc_register_path' as input.

Sets  variable require_pushed_authorization_requests that indicates whether the authorization server accepts authorization request data only via PAR
Supported acr values as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api

Supported display values as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api.
Currently only 'page' is supported

Supported response_types as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api.
Currently only 'normal' is supported

Supported service documentation as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api.
It requires 'host_oauth2_auth_server' and 'service_documentation_path' as input.

Supported ui_locales as specified in the context of OpenID Connect. Defined for the OpenID Connect Discovery api.
Currently only 'en-US' is supported
Used to generate JWT based authorization response

Removes an id_token (jwt). Depending on the configuration the values will be removed via local database using using 'OTK id_token DB Remove' or via routing assertion to an endpoint that implements the database access.
Persists temporary token (authorization_code, request_token). Token Secret and Resource Owner are optional.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: [mag] Third Party SSO Token in base64
Time of authentication (default: now in seconds)

stringValue.value: Handles the response_type CODE. It also persists the generated authorization_code via the 'OTK Token Storage (temporary token)' assertion.
Appends expiration or rexpiration interval to the token
This encapsulated assertion is used to generate JWT as OAuth Token. Customization to the default implementation can be done in the configuration policy #OTK Generate JWT OAuth Token
Handles the response_type TOKEN. It also persists the generated access_token via the 'OTK Token Storage (access_token)' assertion.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: [mag] Third Party SSO Token in base64
Time of authentication (default: now in seconds)

stringValue.value: Handles the response_type 'TOKEN ID_TOKEN' defined for OpenID Connect. It also persists the generated access_token - id_token via the 'OTK Token Storage (access_token)' and 'OTK id_token Persist' assertions.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: [mag] Third Party SSO Token in base64

stringValue.value: Handles the response_type 'CODE ID_TOKEN' defined for OpenID Connect. It also persists the generated authorization_code - id_token via the 'OTK Token Storage (temporary token)' and 'OTK id_token Persist' assertions.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: [mag] Third Party SSO Token in base64:

stringValue.value: Handles the response_type 'ID_TOKEN' defined for OpenID Connect. It also persists the generated id_token via the 'OTK id_token Persist' assertion.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: [mag] Third Party SSO Token in base64
Time of authentication (default: now in seconds)

stringValue.value: Handles the response_type CODE TOKEN. It also persists the generated authorization_code via the 'OTK Token Storage (temporary token)' assertion and persists the generated access_token via the 'OTK Token Storage (access_token)' assertion.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: [mag] Third Party SSO Token in base64
Time of authentication (default: now in seconds)

stringValue.value: Handles the response_type CODE ID_TOKEN TOKEN. It also persists the generated authorization_code via the 'OTK Token Storage (temporary token)' assertion, persists the generated access_token via the 'OTK Token Storage (access_token)' assertion, and persists the generated id_token via the 'OTK id_token Persist' assertion.
Validates a given id_token represented as a JWT. The id_token represents a user session. Optionally it can check the expiration date.
Converts string to json array using space as delimiter.
Exports an OAuth client_id configuration as JSON message.
If set to 'true' the client_secret will be exported. Default = 'false'
This xml MUST be the output of the assertion 'OTK Client GET' configured with parameter 'Operation to use = getAll'
Validates a given grant_type against supported ones within this OTK configuration.
Persists an OAuth 2.0 access_token and refresh_token. The token secret is optional.

Validates a given code_verifier against an exisiting value that was passed in at an original authorization request. The parameter 'Session value' needs to be a JSON structure with including the keys 'code_challenge' and 'code_challenge_method'. The assertion will either fail or proceed.
Handles the extension OAuth grant_type=jwt (urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer). It allows users to be authenticated using a JWT bearer token.
The JWT (id_token) that represents an authentcated user. This token MUST have been issued by OTK
Handles the OAuth grant_type=refresh_token. Validates a given refresh_token and sets the resource_owner and the valid SCOPE.
Handles the extension OAuth grant_type=SAML (urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:saml2-bearer). It allows users to be authenticated using a bearer SAML token.
Verifies the device code as part of device authorization code grant

encapsulatedassertion.name: OTK CIBA Auth Request ID Validation

stringValue.value: Verifies the auth_request_id as part of CIBA grant
